page.title: 19THE SCHOOL, WEST BURTON
page.content: Our village school has a grand title: Burton-cum-Walden, West Burton, Robinson's Memorial CE School. It was built in 1874 by the Robinson sisters in memory of their father, William Robinson. It is controlled by North Yorkshire Education Committee. The school has two main classrooms, cloakrooms, a small dining room and a kitchen. Toilets are outside across a yard. There is a garden with climbing frames but the main playground is the village green. In 1985 there are 49 pupils aged 4 - 11, two full-time teachers, a part-time teacher (9 hours weekly) and a secretary (7 hours weekly). Children come from West Burton, Thoralby, part of Aysgarth and from Walden valley and Bishopdale. Most children come to school by taxi. At 11 they go to the Wensleydale Comprehensive School at Leyburn.
